metadata.title: CVE-2017-7764 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Characters from the "Canadian Syllabics" unicode block can be mixed withcharacters from other unicode blocks in the addressbar instead of beingrendered as their raw "punycode" form, allowing for domain name spoofingattacks through character confusion. The current Unicode standard allowscharacters from "Aspirational Use Scripts" such as Canadian Syllabics to bemixed with Latin characters in the "moderately restrictive" IDN profile. Wehave changed Firefox behavior to match the upcoming Unicode version 10.0which removes this category and treats them as "Limited Use Scripts.". Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 54, Firefox ESR < 52.2, and Thunderbird <52.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
